experimental-muLaw.commit_message:
experimental code to losslessly compress 8-bit muLaw non-linear PCM

- POC and not production ready for lots of reasons, but mostly because much regular
  functionalty is gone and invalid options (e.g., hybrid) are not flagged.
- Uses the standard WavPack decorrelator to generate predictions for LPCM expansion
  of muLaw data, converts the predictions back to muLaw codes (in a continuous form)
  and finally stores the delta muLaw using the standard WavPack entropy encoder.
- A "real" implementation would allow unaware clients of the library to read muLaw
  audio as 16-bit PCM (like DSD works now).
wavpack.c: add option --optimize-32bit to enable new optimized compression for 32-bit audio

libwavpack: new optional optimizations for specific 32-bit float and integer files

- targets specific redundancies (e.g., integer files sourced from float and vice versa)
- in particular, compression improves almost 10% on 32-bit integer files sourced from floats
- creates a new "wvx" bitstream ID that is ignored by older encoders, including FFmpeg
- non-compliant decoders will transparently decode 24-bit "core" audio and report "lossy"
- will not improve on "proper" 32-bit files and so is not recommended for general use
fix MSVC warnings
wvgain.c: add "-t" option to enable multithreading (which now works for stereo and mono)

wvunpack.c: with --threads and stereo/mono, use buffers sized for temporal multithreading

- removed old undocumented "-k" option for specifying output buffer size
wavpack.c: with --threads and stereo/mono, use buffers sized for temporal multithreading

libwavpack: extend multithreaded encoding to stereo and mono files

- multichannel encoding is spatially multithreaded; this is temporal multithreading
- to take advantage of this, WavpackPackSamples() must be called with large buffers
- improve all multithreaded performance by encoding the final block in the foreground

libwavpack: extend multithreaded decoding to stereo and mono files

- multichannel decoding is spatially multithreaded; this is temporal multithreading
- to take advantage of this, WavpackUnpackSamples() must be called with large buffers
- improve all multithreaded performance by decoding the final block in the foreground
aiff.c: allow AIFF files with a non-zero "offset" or a non-zero but valid "blockSize" in the sound chunk
Windows: set _WIN32_WINNT for advanced Win32 features
bump revision to 5.6.4 for potential multithreaded test release
wvunpack.c: fix warning (possibly uninitialized variable)
pack_utils.c: remove C99-ism
Visual Studio: update project file for multithreading and squash new warning

wvtest.c: add "--threads" option for multithreaded testing
          (next should update to native Windows threads)
wavpack.c, wvunpack.c: add "--threads" to select multithreading (multichannel files)

libwavpack: add support for multithreaded encoding and decoding

- only multichannel audio is supported for now (PCM or DSD)
- uses pthreads or native Windows threading via macros & typedefs
- optionally built, and not enabled by default in libwavpack
- no new API to enable, uses new flags and unused fields
unpack_dsd.c: safe to cast away the const, but mind those sneaky side-effects!

libwavpack: refactor to aid implementation of threading of multichannel audio

- pass just the WavpackStream when the entire context is not needed
- add a read-only pointer from the stream back to the context
- remove the "current_stream" idea from WavpackContext
wavpack.c: don't delete source files with certain warnings that could cause data loss
wavpack.c: round up DSD sample rates to avoid falsely detecting zero
wavpack.c, docs: allow hybrid bitrate to also be specified with "-c" option (not just "-b" option)
issue #161, wvtest.c: add another check for invalid WavPack files to the seeking test harness
import_id3.c: do not reject ID3v2 tags with footers

fix build with watcom compiler

utils.c(581): Error! E1054: Expression must be constant
utils.c(581): Error! E1054: Expression must be constant
wavpack.c: delay display of tag import until after verify, update copyright dates
utils.c: FillConsoleOutputCharacter() is cleaner and more reliable under Wine than spewing spaces
bump revision to 5.6.2 for ID3v2.4 tag import test release
fix build in c89 mode
wavpack.c: don't allow a WavPack source file with --raw-pcm (makes no sense)
squash warnings from mingw

import_id3.c: improvements to ID3v2 tag import, including ID3v2.4 support

- allow multiple NULL-separated values per item, either directly or with multiple entries
- import "Comment" from COMM tag (if it doesn't contain a separate description)
- allow ID3v2.4 tags with new tag fields TSST, TDRC, TMOO, and TSSE
- import complete list of picture types, e.g., "Cover Art (Artist)"
- allow all 4 text encodings (ISO, UTF-16, UTF-16BE, UTF-8)
wavpack.c: after creating a solitary .wv file, delete any similarly-named, now obsolete, .wvc file
autotools, cmake: add -Wall to CFLAGS for gcc (or clang)

Silence gcc-9 -Wstringop-truncation warnings:

cli/wavpack.c: In function 'main':
cli/wavpack.c:350:5: warning: 'strncpy' specified bound 4096 equals destination size [-Wstringop-truncation]
  350 |     strncpy (selfname, *argv, sizeof (selfname));
      |     ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
cli/wvunpack.c: In function 'main':
cli/wvunpack.c:288:5: warning: 'strncpy' specified bound 4096 equals destination size [-Wstringop-truncation]
  288 |     strncpy (selfname, *argv, sizeof (selfname));
      |     ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
manpages: PR feedback
manpages: minor tweaks, including using .Ss macro to put FORMATS and OPTIONS into their own subsection
cmake: we don't need XSLT any more
drop -nosplit
add myself to manpage authors
--enable-man is pointless now
fix: manpages are in the SOURCEDIR

wavpack -options

These should be spelled out, but the mixture
of short -o options and --long-options makes that almost impossible.
Let's leave -options for now and sort it in tree.

wavpack.1 in mdoc(7)

This is an initial commit of wapack.1 in mdoc(7),
produced with docbook2mdoc and lightly edited
to accommodate all mandoc -Tlint warnings:

- trim lines to < 80 chars
- new sentence, new line
- replace the legacy Dd 2022-11-16 format with Dd January 4, 2023
- order Xr cross-references alphabeticaly

Minimal edits of actual content:

- drop the nonstandard Sh OPTIONS header
- use the standard Sh AUTHORS instead of
  the nonstandard Sh COPYRIGHT section
- other minor tweaks, mostly grammatical
cleanup xml leftovers

wvunpack.1 in mdoc(7)

This is an initial commit of wvuppack.1 in mdoc(7)
produced with docbook2mdoc and lightly edited
to accommodate all mandoc -Tlint warnings:

- trim lines to < 80 chars
- new sentence, new line
- replace the legacy Dd 2022-11-16 format with Dd January 4, 2023
- order Xr cross-references alphabeticaly
- order Sh AUTHORS alphabeticaly

Minimal edits of actual content:

- use the imperative "decode" as opposed to the descriptive "decodes"
- drop the nonstandard Sh OPTIONS header
- use the standard Sh AUTHORS instead of
  the nonstandard Sh COPYRIGHT section
- other minor tweaks

drop DocBook

Now that we have proper manpages, we can drop the DocBook dependency
(which, when building, is orders of magnitude larger than wavpack itself).

wvtag.1 in mdoc(7)

This is an initial commit of wvtag.1 in mdoc(7)
produced with docbook2mdoc and lightly edited
to accommodate all mandoc -Tlint warnings:

- trim lines to < 80 chars
- new sentence, new line
- replace the legacy Dd 2022-11-16 format with Dd January 2, 2023
- order Xr cross-references alphabeticaly

Minimal edits of actual content:

- use the imperative "manipulate wavpack metadata"
  as opposed to "metadata utility for wavpack files"
  (of course it's a utility that works with files)
- drop the nonstandard Sh OPTIONS header
- use the standard Sh AUTHORS instead of
  the nonstandard Sh COPYRIGHT section
- spell out the actual option flags in SYNOPSIS,
  as far as the confusing -x -xx etc allow

wvgain.1 in mdoc(7)

This is the initial version of wvgain.1,
produced with docbook2mdoc and lightly edited
to accommodate all mandoc -Tlint warnings:

- trim lines to < 80 chars
- new sentence, new line
- replace the legacy Dd 2022-11-16 format with Dd January 2, 2023
- order Xr cross-references alphabeticaly

Minimal edits of actual content:

- use the canonical imperative: "add ReplayGain ..."
  as opposed to the descriptive "adds ReplayGain ..."
- drop the nonstandard Sh OPTIONS header
- use the standard Sh AUTHORS instead of
  the nonstandard Sh COPYRIGHT section
- spell out the actual option flags in SYNOPSIS
- order AUTHORS alphabeticaly
cmake: calculate macho current/compatibility version
cmake: fix dll filename of mingw library

cmake: set SOVERSION and VERSION property of wavpack

This is used to version .so libraries on Linux
cmake: extract libtool from configure.ac and convert to SOVERSION

cmake: allow wavpack to be installed by a master project

Installation of wavpack by a master project (=project including wavpack) failed
because include/wavpack.h is found relative to the location of install().

cmake: fix dll filename of mingw library

cmake: set SOVERSION and VERSION property of wavpack

This is used to version .so libraries on Linux
cmake: extract libtool from configure.ac and convert to SOVERSION

cmake: allow wavpack to be installed by a master project

Installation of wavpack by a master project (=project including wavpack) failed
because include/wavpack.h is found relative to the location of install().

master.commit_message: cmake: don't enable tests and programs when building wavpack as a subproject
issue #162: add <max> version (3.5) to silence CMake deprecation warning

cool_wv4.c: move reading of different float normalizations to inside plugin

- fixes bug where normalization status of imported files was wrong
- add macros to make different normalizations clearer

cool_wv4.c: add multithreading to Cool Edit / Audition filter, bump revision to 4.0

- also includes read-support for new --optimize-32bit files (although any actual
  difference will be over 140 dB down)
cool_wv4.c: squash warnings, mostly related to strncpy()

libwavpack: for Windows threading use _beginthreadex()/_endthreadex()

- Google: CreateThread()/ExitThread() should not be used with the CRT
wavpack.c: error on attempt to use "--optimize-32bit" with lossy; update help text
bump revision to 5.6.6 for test release
fix "--disable-threads" configure option and add appropriate messaging to CLI programs
pack.c, pack_utils.c: improve -x1 and -x2 compression under temporal multithreading
pack_utils.c: don't reset packing code on threading discontinuities in 'extra' modes
wavpack.c: add option --optimize-32bit to enable new optimized compression for 32-bit audio

libwavpack: new optional optimizations for specific 32-bit float and integer files

- targets specific redundancies (e.g., integer files sourced from float and vice versa)
- in particular, compression improves almost 10% on 32-bit integer files sourced from floats
- creates a new "wvx" bitstream ID that is ignored by older encoders, including FFmpeg
- non-compliant decoders will transparently decode 24-bit "core" audio and report "lossy"
- will not improve on "proper" 32-bit files and so is not recommended for general use
fix MSVC warnings
wvgain.c: add "-t" option to enable multithreading (which now works for stereo and mono)

wvunpack.c: with --threads and stereo/mono, use buffers sized for temporal multithreading

- removed old undocumented "-k" option for specifying output buffer size
wavpack.c: with --threads and stereo/mono, use buffers sized for temporal multithreading

libwavpack: extend multithreaded encoding to stereo and mono files

- multichannel encoding is spatially multithreaded; this is temporal multithreading
- to take advantage of this, WavpackPackSamples() must be called with large buffers
- improve all multithreaded performance by encoding the final block in the foreground

libwavpack: extend multithreaded decoding to stereo and mono files

- multichannel decoding is spatially multithreaded; this is temporal multithreading
- to take advantage of this, WavpackUnpackSamples() must be called with large buffers
- improve all multithreaded performance by decoding the final block in the foreground
aiff.c: allow AIFF files with a non-zero "offset" or a non-zero but valid "blockSize" in the sound chunk
Windows: set _WIN32_WINNT for advanced Win32 features
bump revision to 5.6.4 for potential multithreaded test release
wvunpack.c: fix warning (possibly uninitialized variable)
pack_utils.c: remove C99-ism
Visual Studio: update project file for multithreading and squash new warning

wvtest.c: add "--threads" option for multithreaded testing
          (next should update to native Windows threads)
wavpack.c, wvunpack.c: add "--threads" to select multithreading (multichannel files)

libwavpack: add support for multithreaded encoding and decoding

- only multichannel audio is supported for now (PCM or DSD)
- uses pthreads or native Windows threading via macros & typedefs
- optionally built, and not enabled by default in libwavpack
- no new API to enable, uses new flags and unused fields
unpack_dsd.c: safe to cast away the const, but mind those sneaky side-effects!

libwavpack: refactor to aid implementation of threading of multichannel audio

- pass just the WavpackStream when the entire context is not needed
- add a read-only pointer from the stream back to the context
- remove the "current_stream" idea from WavpackContext
wavpack.c: don't delete source files with certain warnings that could cause data loss
wavpack.c: round up DSD sample rates to avoid falsely detecting zero
wavpack.c, docs: allow hybrid bitrate to also be specified with "-c" option (not just "-b" option)
issue #161, wvtest.c: add another check for invalid WavPack files to the seeking test harness
import_id3.c: do not reject ID3v2 tags with footers

fix build with watcom compiler

utils.c(581): Error! E1054: Expression must be constant
utils.c(581): Error! E1054: Expression must be constant
wavpack.c: delay display of tag import until after verify, update copyright dates
utils.c: FillConsoleOutputCharacter() is cleaner and more reliable under Wine than spewing spaces
bump revision to 5.6.2 for ID3v2.4 tag import test release
fix build in c89 mode
wavpack.c: don't allow a WavPack source file with --raw-pcm (makes no sense)
squash warnings from mingw

import_id3.c: improvements to ID3v2 tag import, including ID3v2.4 support

- allow multiple NULL-separated values per item, either directly or with multiple entries
- import "Comment" from COMM tag (if it doesn't contain a separate description)
- allow ID3v2.4 tags with new tag fields TSST, TDRC, TMOO, and TSSE
- import complete list of picture types, e.g., "Cover Art (Artist)"
- allow all 4 text encodings (ISO, UTF-16, UTF-16BE, UTF-8)
wavpack.c: after creating a solitary .wv file, delete any similarly-named, now obsolete, .wvc file
autotools, cmake: add -Wall to CFLAGS for gcc (or clang)

Silence gcc-9 -Wstringop-truncation warnings:

cli/wavpack.c: In function 'main':
cli/wavpack.c:350:5: warning: 'strncpy' specified bound 4096 equals destination size [-Wstringop-truncation]
  350 |     strncpy (selfname, *argv, sizeof (selfname));
      |     ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
cli/wvunpack.c: In function 'main':
cli/wvunpack.c:288:5: warning: 'strncpy' specified bound 4096 equals destination size [-Wstringop-truncation]
  288 |     strncpy (selfname, *argv, sizeof (selfname));
      |     ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

- order AUTHORS alphabeticaly
cmake: calculate macho current/compatibility version
cmake: fix dll filename of mingw library

cmake: set SOVERSION and VERSION property of wavpack

This is used to version .so libraries on Linux
cmake: extract libtool from configure.ac and convert to SOVERSION

cmake: allow wavpack to be installed by a master project

Installation of wavpack by a master project (=project including wavpack) failed
because include/wavpack.h is found relative to the location of install().

refactor-2023.commit_message: bump revision to 5.6.4 for potential multithreaded test release
wvunpack.c: fix warning (possibly uninitialized variable)
pack_utils.c: remove C99-ism
Visual Studio: update project file for multithreading and squash new warning

wvtest.c: add "--threads" option for multithreaded testing
          (next should update to native Windows threads)
wavpack.c, wvunpack.c: add "--threads" to select multithreading (multichannel files)

libwavpack: add support for multithreaded encoding and decoding

- only multichannel audio is supported for now (PCM or DSD)
- uses pthreads or native Windows threading via macros & typedefs
- optionally built, and not enabled by default in libwavpack
- no new API to enable, uses new flags and unused fields
unpack_dsd.c: safe to cast away the const, but mind those sneaky side-effects!

libwavpack: refactor to aid implementation of threading of multichannel audio

- pass just the WavpackStream when the entire context is not needed
- add a read-only pointer from the stream back to the context
- remove the "current_stream" idea from WavpackContext
wavpack.c: don't delete source files with certain warnings that could cause data loss
wavpack.c: round up DSD sample rates to avoid falsely detecting zero
wavpack.c, docs: allow hybrid bitrate to also be specified with "-c" option (not just "-b" option)
issue #161, wvtest.c: add another check for invalid WavPack files to the seeking test harness
import_id3.c: do not reject ID3v2 tags with footers

fix build with watcom compiler

utils.c(581): Error! E1054: Expression must be constant
utils.c(581): Error! E1054: Expression must be constant
wavpack.c: delay display of tag import until after verify, update copyright dates
utils.c: FillConsoleOutputCharacter() is cleaner and more reliable under Wine than spewing spaces
bump revision to 5.6.2 for ID3v2.4 tag import test release
fix build in c89 mode
wavpack.c: don't allow a WavPack source file with --raw-pcm (makes no sense)
squash warnings from mingw

import_id3.c: improvements to ID3v2 tag import, including ID3v2.4 support

- allow multiple NULL-separated values per item, either directly or with multiple entries
- import "Comment" from COMM tag (if it doesn't contain a separate description)
- allow ID3v2.4 tags with new tag fields TSST, TDRC, TMOO, and TSSE
- import complete list of picture types, e.g., "Cover Art (Artist)"
- allow all 4 text encodings (ISO, UTF-16, UTF-16BE, UTF-8)
wavpack.c: after creating a solitary .wv file, delete any similarly-named, now obsolete, .wvc file
autotools, cmake: add -Wall to CFLAGS for gcc (or clang)

Silence gcc-9 -Wstringop-truncation warnings:

cli/wavpack.c: In function 'main':
cli/wavpack.c:350:5: warning: 'strncpy' specified bound 4096 equals destination size [-Wstringop-truncation]
  350 |     strncpy (selfname, *argv, sizeof (selfname));
      |     ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
cli/wvunpack.c: In function 'main':
cli/wvunpack.c:288:5: warning: 'strncpy' specified bound 4096 equals destination size [-Wstringop-truncation]
  288 |     strncpy (selfname, *argv, sizeof (selfname));
      |     ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
manpages: PR feedback
manpages: minor tweaks, including using .Ss macro to put FORMATS and OPTIONS into their own subsection
cmake: we don't need XSLT any more
drop -nosplit
add myself to manpage authors
--enable-man is pointless now
fix: manpages are in the SOURCEDIR

wavpack -options

These should be spelled out, but the mixture
of short -o options and --long-options makes that almost impossible.
Let's leave -options for now and sort it in tree.

wavpack.1 in mdoc(7)

This is an initial commit of wapack.1 in mdoc(7),
produced with docbook2mdoc and lightly edited
to accommodate all mandoc -Tlint warnings:

- trim lines to < 80 chars
- new sentence, new line
- replace the legacy Dd 2022-11-16 format with Dd January 4, 2023
- order Xr cross-references alphabeticaly

Minimal edits of actual content:

- drop the nonstandard Sh OPTIONS header
- use the standard Sh AUTHORS instead of
  the nonstandard Sh COPYRIGHT section
- other minor tweaks, mostly grammatical
cleanup xml leftovers

wvunpack.1 in mdoc(7)

This is an initial commit of wvuppack.1 in mdoc(7)
produced with docbook2mdoc and lightly edited
to accommodate all mandoc -Tlint warnings:

- trim lines to < 80 chars
- new sentence, new line
- replace the legacy Dd 2022-11-16 format with Dd January 4, 2023
- order Xr cross-references alphabeticaly
- order Sh AUTHORS alphabeticaly

Minimal edits of actual content:

- use the imperative "decode" as opposed to the descriptive "decodes"
- drop the nonstandard Sh OPTIONS header
- use the standard Sh AUTHORS instead of
  the nonstandard Sh COPYRIGHT section
- other minor tweaks

drop DocBook

Now that we have proper manpages, we can drop the DocBook dependency
(which, when building, is orders of magnitude larger than wavpack itself).

wvtag.1 in mdoc(7)

This is an initial commit of wvtag.1 in mdoc(7)
produced with docbook2mdoc and lightly edited
to accommodate all mandoc -Tlint warnings:

- trim lines to < 80 chars
- new sentence, new line
- replace the legacy Dd 2022-11-16 format with Dd January 2, 2023
- order Xr cross-references alphabeticaly

Minimal edits of actual content:

- use the imperative "manipulate wavpack metadata"
  as opposed to "metadata utility for wavpack files"
  (of course it's a utility that works with files)
- drop the nonstandard Sh OPTIONS header
- use the standard Sh AUTHORS instead of
  the nonstandard Sh COPYRIGHT section
- spell out the actual option flags in SYNOPSIS,
  as far as the confusing -x -xx etc allow

wvgain.1 in mdoc(7)

This is the initial version of wvgain.1,
produced with docbook2mdoc and lightly edited
to accommodate all mandoc -Tlint warnings:

- trim lines to < 80 chars
- new sentence, new line
- replace the legacy Dd 2022-11-16 format with Dd January 2, 2023
- order Xr cross-references alphabeticaly

Minimal edits of actual content:

- use the canonical imperative: "add ReplayGain ..."
  as opposed to the descriptive "adds ReplayGain ..."
- drop the nonstandard Sh OPTIONS header
- use the standard Sh AUTHORS instead of
  the nonstandard Sh COPYRIGHT section
- spell out the actual option flags in SYNOPSIS
- order AUTHORS alphabeticaly
